text: Carcina quercana is a species of moth of the family Depressariidae. It is found in Europe. It has been introduced recently in North America, British Columbia and western Washington. It is occasionally known by several common names including oak lantern, long-horned flat-body, and oak-skeletonizer moth (the last most common in North America). A leaf of Sorbus torminalis with larval web Larva The wingspan is 16–20 mm. The larvae feed on various deciduous trees, including Oak and Beech. ==References== ==External links== *Carcina quercana at UKmoths *Lepiforum.de Category:Moths described in 1775 Category:Peleopodinae Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Turkey Category:Taxa named by Johan Christian Fabricius
title: Carcina quercana
